comment:
REVIEW: CR-095 v0.1 — COMPLIANT. Recommend for approval.

FRONTMATTER:
- title: "Attachment Auto-Close + VR Template/Compiler Refinements" — present, non-empty
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" — acceptable for v0.1 per SOP-002 Section 8

STRUCTURE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present: Purpose, Scope, Current State, Proposed State, Change Description, Justification, Impact Assessment, Testing Summary, Implementation Plan, Execution, Execution Summary, References.

PLACEHOLDER CONTENT:
No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX in pre-approved content (Sections 1-9, 12). Editable fields in Sections 10-11 contain expected execution-phase templates per SOP-004 Section 4.2.

TRACEABILITY:
- SOP-004 Section 9C.2 claim verified: "closed when parent document closes" confirmed in SOP-004 VR Lifecycle workflow
- References SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-004, SOP-005, SOP-006, CR-094 — all valid
- Parent Document: None (independent improvement) — appropriate

TECHNICAL ASSESSMENT:
Theme A (Attachment Lifecycle): Sound generic approach. attachment flag provides extensibility. Terminal state checkout guard closes a gap against SOP-001 Section 8.3. Cascade close implements SOP-004 9C.2 mandate. Auto-compile before cascade close prevents data loss for checked-out interactive documents.

Theme B (Template/Compiler): Template v5 changes well-itemized. Removing Signature/References sections aligns with SOP-004 9C.2 (no independent approval cycle). Auto-metadata, block rendering, attribution placement, and step subsection numbering are clearly specified.

BUNDLING: Both themes affect qms-cli. Logical grouping — Theme A implements lifecycle integration, Theme B improves output quality for the same document type. Reasonable scope.

IMPACT ASSESSMENT: Files Affected, Documents Affected, Development Controls, and Qualified State Continuity all complete. Six new requirements identified for SDLC-QMS-RS/RTM.

EI TABLE: 12 items. EI-1 and EI-12 satisfy SOP-004 Section 5 pre/post-execution commit requirements. EI-6 flagged for VR (integration verification). Structure aligns with implementation plan phases.

FORMATTING: No typos, consistent section numbering, consistent table formatting, consistent horizontal rules.

CR-095 v1.0 POST-REVIEW — NON-COMPLIANT. Request updates.

CRITICAL DEFICIENCY: Execution content not checked into the document.

The CR was routed for post-review without execution results being recorded in the controlled document. The audit trail confirms no CHECKOUT or CHECKIN event occurred between RELEASE (2026-02-22T01:14:07) and ROUTE POST_REVIEW (2026-02-22T03:57:33). Both the QMS read command and direct file inspection of CR-095-draft.md confirm the following:

SECTION 10 (Execution): All 12 execution items contain placeholder markers:
- Execution Summary column: "[SUMMARY]" in all 12 rows (EI-1 through EI-12)
- Task Outcome column: "[Pass/Fail]" in all 12 rows
- Performed By - Date column: "[PERFORMER] - [DATE]" in all 12 rows

SECTION 10 (Execution Comments): Contains placeholder "[COMMENT]" / "[PERFORMER] - [DATE]"

SECTION 11 (Execution Summary): Contains placeholder "[EXECUTION_SUMMARY]"

SOP-002 SECTION 7.3 VERIFICATION FAILURES:

1. Execution Complete (7.3.1): FAILED — No execution items have Task Outcome recorded. All 12 EIs show "[Pass/Fail]".

2. Evidence Documented (7.3.4): FAILED — No completion evidence recorded in Execution Summary column. All EIs show "[SUMMARY]".

3. VRs Complete (7.3.6): FAILED — EI-6 is flagged "Yes" in the VR column but no CR-095-VR document exists in the QMS (confirmed via file system search).

4. Execution Summary (Section 11): FAILED — Contains only the placeholder "[EXECUTION_SUMMARY]" with no narrative of execution results.

REQUIRED CORRECTIVE ACTION:

The initiator must:
1. Check out CR-095
2. Fill in all execution results in Section 10 (Execution Summary, Task Outcome, Performed By - Date for all 12 EIs)
3. Fill in Execution Comments with relevant observations
4. Write the Section 11 Execution Summary narrative
5. Create and complete the VR for EI-6 (integration verification)
6. Check in the completed document
7. Re-route for post-review

NOTE: The execution summary provided in the routing message (describing EI-1 through EI-12 completion, 673 tests passing, commit hashes, etc.) was not recorded in the controlled document. The routing message is not a substitute for document content — execution evidence must be in the CR itself per SOP-002 Section 6.10.
